questions.question_text: Maintenance entitlements can be associated with what types of entitlements (for non-Microsoft publishers)? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
The answer is A, B, D as per page 290 in the SAM book that comes with the SAM course.
Upgrade, Perpetual, Perpetual + Maintenance

comments.content: Validated by creating a new "Common" Entitlement. I see your 3 indicated answers as pick-values under "License type". Thanks!

questions.question_text: How are Microsoft Office 365 reserved licenses handled after true-up?

choices.A: They are automatically converted into regular licenses
choices.C: They are automatically deleted and must be re-reserved
choices.D: They are automatically removed from true-up calculations and billed separately
choices.B: They are automatically disabled until additional licenses are purchased

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Manage Microsoft Office 365 reserved licenses to accurately calculate annual true-up cost. 

Create reserve entitlements from existing Microsoft Office 365 subscription entitlements to add licenses to your subscription. The total cost of the reserved entitlement is included in the calculations for true-up cost and total spend on the product.

Pay for the new licenses during your true-up process; after true-up, the reserved licenses are automatically converted into regular licenses.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A - they are automatically converted to regular licenses
This is on page 292 in the SAM book from the SAM course.

choices.A: Software Models with deactivated discovery maps

questions.question_text: Using end-of-life/end-of-support software exposes your organization to security threats. What report can you run to gain visibility to these products?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's D.
- if you go to sys_report.list you'll see it named "Software Lifecycle Report"...
- but when you navigate to Software Asset Workspace > License Usage > Report, same same report is called "Software Product Lifecycle Report".

comments.content: Furthermore, the "correct answer" that this exam is suggesting at B is wrong as License Position Report only shows compliancy details: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sam-license-position-report.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agreed with everyone. Provided 2 links, below on the comments. 
"View the Software Product Lifecycle report to be informed about the products nearing end-of-life, end-of-support, and end-of-extended support. View the report by navigating to Reports > View/Run. The report is based on the scheduled job, SAM - Generate Data For Software Lifecycle Report.

Software Lifecycle Report
The Software Lifecycle Report [sam_sw_product_lifecycle_report] table calculates the current and upcoming lifecycle phases from the lifecycle phases mentioned in the Software Product Lifecycle [sam_sw_product_lifecyle] table"

comments.content: Agreed as well. Searched for "Software Product Lifecycle Report" in SN docs: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/software-models-and-entitlements.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
Question #113 says ABE, but I can't back that up with any documentation.

Selected Answer: ACD
I had a hard time with this one, I definitely feel the answers are:
A - Assess publisher compliance over a period of time

The others I am thinking:
C. Configure software reclamation (You can action this from the Software Asset Workspace>Optimization and savings>Removal Candidate)
D. Remediate non-compliance

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/use/dashboards/application-content-packs/software-asset-mgmt-content-pack.html

I don't see where there is PA information about trends for allocations or usage of software as it relates to anything outside of reclamation...

choices.B: View trends of software license allocations
choices.A: Assess publisher compliance over a period of time
choices.E: Track usage of a particular software

questions.question_text: Performance Analytics allows users to do which of the following? (Choose three.)

A user is notified their software install has been flagged for reclamation. The user declines approval.
What is the next step in the workflow?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B -the user's manager must review and approve or deny reclamation.
as per page 420 in the SAM book from the SAM course

choices.E: A justification is requested and submitted to Change Management for approval.
choices.D: The software is reclaimed since it was not in use the notification was only informational.
choices.C: The reclamation candidate is removed from the candidate list.
choices.B: The userâ€™s manager must approve or decline the reclamation.
